derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent. (as a noun): from modern Latin invertebrata (plural) 'the invertebrates' (former taxonomic group), from French invertébrés, from in- 'without' + Latin vertebra (see vertebra)

entry.def: An invertebrate is a creature that does not have a spine, for example an insect, a worm, or an octopus.

means.word_mean: 1. any animal lacking a backbone or notochord; the term is not used as a scientific classification
1. lacking a backbone or spinal column;
